services.title: Psychological First Aid
services.short: Immediate emotional support during crisis or distress.

details.description: Psychological First Aid (PFA) provides immediate, compassionate support to individuals facing acute stress, trauma, or crisis. It helps stabilize emotions, reduce distress, and promote safety and comfort during overwhelming situations.
details.who: Anyone experiencing shock, emotional distress, trauma, crisis events, or overwhelming stress. Suitable for children, adolescents, and adults.
methodology: Ensuring safety, comfort, and a calm environment.
Listening without pressuring the person to talk.
Assessing immediate needs and providing practical assistance.
Connecting individuals to social support and professional help.
Offering grounding techniques to manage acute stress.
details.duration: Usually delivered immediately after a crisis. Can be a single session (20–45 minutes) or multiple short sessions depending on the situation.
benefits: Reduces emotional distress and prevents long-term trauma.
Promotes safety, calmness, and stability during crises.
Helps individuals regain control and coping ability.
Provides immediate emotional and practical support.
details.notes: PFA is not formal therapy but immediate early support. It does not require discussing the traumatic event in detail.

details.description: Individual therapy focuses on personal growth, coping strategies, and overcoming anxiety, depression, or stress through tailored sessions.
details.who: Adults, adolescents, and teenagers who face personal challenges, stress, anxiety, or depression.
methodology: One-on-one sessions with a licensed therapist.
Goal setting and coping strategy development.
Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) or other evidence-based approaches.
Progress tracking and homework exercises between sessions.
details.duration: 45-60 minute sessions, typically 6-12 sessions depending on needs.
benefits: Reduces anxiety, depression, and stress symptoms.
Helps set and achieve personal goals.
details.notes: Sessions are confidential. Frequency can be weekly or bi-weekly.

details.description: Couples counseling helps partners improve communication, rebuild trust, and strengthen their relationship through guided sessions.
details.who: Couples experiencing communication issues, conflicts, or relationship stress.
methodology: Joint sessions with both partners and a therapist.
Identifying patterns and triggers in the relationship.
Communication skill training.
Conflict resolution and emotional support techniques.
details.duration: 50-60 minute sessions, usually 6-10 sessions depending on progress.
benefits: Provides tools for resolving conflicts effectively.
details.notes: Both partners must be committed to attend sessions regularly.

details.description: Group therapy provides a safe environment to share experiences, receive support, and learn coping strategies from peers facing similar challenges.
details.who: Individuals seeking peer support, social skill development, or recovery guidance.
methodology: Small group sessions led by a therapist.
Sharing experiences and discussing challenges.
Group exercises to improve coping and social skills.
Feedback and mutual support from participants.
details.duration: 60-90 minute sessions, usually weekly for 8-12 weeks.
benefits: Provides a sense of belonging and support.
Offers diverse perspectives on common problems.
details.notes: Attendance and participation are encouraged for maximum benefit.

services.title: Online Consultation
services.short: Therapy from the comfort of your home.

details.description: Online consultation allows clients to receive therapy via video calls, making mental health support accessible anytime, anywhere.
details.who: Individuals or couples unable to attend in-person sessions or preferring remote therapy.
methodology: Secure video conferencing sessions.
Same techniques as in-person therapy (CBT, counseling, coaching).
Flexible scheduling and follow-up sessions.
Homework and digital resources shared online.
details.duration: 45-60 minute sessions, frequency depends on individual needs.
benefits: Maintains progress with digital support materials.
details.notes: Requires a stable internet connection and private space.

services.title: Play Therapy
services.short: Helping children express emotions through play.

details.description: Play therapy uses structured play to help children communicate feelings, overcome trauma, and develop social and emotional skills.
details.who: Children aged 3-12 with emotional, behavioral, or developmental challenges.
methodology: Guided play using toys, art, and role-play.
Observation and interpretation by trained therapists.
Integration of parental feedback and involvement.
Development of coping strategies through play.
details.notes: Parental involvement may be included in some sessions.

services.title: Behavioral Therapy
services.short: Improving behavior and coping skills in children.

details.description: Behavioral therapy focuses on identifying and changing negative behaviors while reinforcing positive behaviors in children.
details.who: Children and adolescents with ADHD, anxiety, or behavioral challenges.
methodology: Behavior tracking and assessment.
Positive reinforcement for desired behaviors.
Skill-building exercises to manage emotions.
Parental guidance and reinforcement at home.
benefits: Reduces negative behaviors and emotional outbursts.
Supports academic and home life success.
details.notes: Collaboration with parents and teachers improves effectiveness.

details.description: Child counseling addresses emotional, social, and developmental concerns, guiding children through challenges at home, school, or with peers.
details.who: Children experiencing emotional distress, school challenges, or social difficulties.
methodology: Individual sessions tailored to the child's needs.
Therapeutic activities including discussion, play, and art.
Goal setting for emotional and social growth.
Collaboration with parents and educators as needed.
benefits: Strengthens coping strategies and problem-solving skills.
Guides children through academic and family challenges.
details.notes: Sessions are supportive and child-friendly, confidential and safe.

services.title: IQ Test
services.short: Assess cognitive abilities and intellectual potential.

details.description: The IQ Test evaluates an individual's cognitive abilities, problem-solving skills, logical reasoning, and intellectual capacity. It provides insights into strengths and areas for improvement across multiple cognitive domains.
details.who: Students, job applicants, professionals, and anyone interested in understanding their intellectual strengths and cognitive profile.
methodology: Standardized questions covering logic, mathematics, spatial reasoning, and pattern recognition.
Timed assessments to evaluate quick thinking and decision-making.
Adaptive testing approach depending on difficulty level.
Score interpretation based on international IQ scales.
details.duration: Typically 20–45 minutes, depending on the number of sections and difficulty level.
benefits: Helps in academic and career planning.
Provides a benchmark for intellectual development.
details.notes: This test is not a measure of a person's worth or future success. Results may vary based on mood, environment, and test format.
